questions.answers: 1<break time='1s'/> 8 bytes, 2<break time='1s'/> 4 bytes, 3<break time='1s'/> 2 bytes, 4<break time='1s'/> 1 byte
questions.correctAnswer: 8 bytes.  Long is the datatype keyword used for storing data of unlimited length so by definition its size is always maximum.
questions.text: How many Bytes are stored by Long Datatype in C sharp dot net <break time='1s'/>

questions.answers: 1<break time='1s'/> s byte, 2<break time='1s'/> short, 3<break time='1s'/> int, 4<break time='1s'/> long
questions.correctAnswer: s byte. Wider datatype like int long takes more time for manipulation of a program.
questions.text: Which datatype should be more preferred for storing a simple number like 35 to improve execution speed of a program.

questions.answers: 1<break time='1s'/> Long Int, 2<break time='1s'/> Unsigned Long,  3<break time='1s'/> Int, 4<break time='1s'/> Unsigned Int
questions.text: What is the Default Type of number without decimal.

questions.answers: 1<break time='1s'/> 10 Bytes, 2<break time='1s'/> 6 Bytes, 3<break time='1s'/> 4 Bytes, 4<break time='1s'/> 8 Bytes
questions.text: What is the Valid Size of float datatype.

questions.answers: 1<break time='1s'/> 8 bit, 2<break time='1s'/> 12 bit, 3<break time='1s'/> 16 bit, 4<break time='1s'/> 20 bit
questions.correctAnswer: 16 bit. A char is unicode in C sharp, therefore the number of possible characters exceeds 255. So you'll need two bytes.
questions.text: What is the Size of Char datatype.

questions.answers: 1 <break time='1s'/> To create string on stack. 2<break time='1s'/> To reduce size of string. 3<break time='1s'/> To overcome problem of stackoverflow. 4<break time='1s'/> None of the mentioned
questions.correctAnswer: To reduce size of string.  The problem of stack overflow very likely to occur since transport protocol used on web these days are ‘HTTP’ and data standard as XML. Hence, both make use of strings extensively which will result in stack overflow problem. So, to avoid this situation it is good idea to make strings a reference type and hence create it on heap.
questions.text: Why strings are of reference type in C sharp .NET <break time='1s'/>

questions.answers: 1<break time='1s'/>Var is introduced in C sharp 3.0 and Dynamic is introduced in C sharp 4.0. 2<break time='1s'/> Var is a type of variable where declaration is done at compile time by compiler while Dynamic declaration is achieved at runtime by compiler. 3<break time='1s'/> For Var Error is caught at compile time and for Dynamic Error is caught at runtime. 4<break time='1s'/> All of the mentioned
questions.text: what is the DIFFERENCE BETWEEN KEYWORDS VAR AND DYNAMIC.

questions.answers: 1<break time='1s'/> Boxing is the process of converting a value type to the reference type and Unboxing is the process of converting reference to value type. 2<break time='1s'/> Boxing is the process of converting a reference type to value type and Unboxing is the process of converting value type to reference type. 3<break time='1s'/> In Boxing we need explicit conversion and in Unboxing we need implicit conversion. 4<break time='1s'/> Both Boxing and Unboxing we need implicit conversion
questions.correctAnswer: Boxing is the process of converting a value type to the reference type and Unboxing is the process of converting reference to value type
questions.text: What is the difference between Boxing and Unboxing.

questions.answers: 1<break time='1s'/> Implicit Conversion. 2<break time='1s'/> Explicit Conversion. 3<break time='1s'/> Implicit Conversion and Explicit Conversion. 4<break time='1s'/> None of the mentioned.
questions.text: what Types of Data Conversion are in C sharp.

questions.answers: 1<break time='1s'/> To store a value of one data type into a variable of another data type. 2<break time='1s'/> To get desired data. 3<break time='1s'/> To prevent situations of run time error during change or conversion of data type. 4<break time='1s'/> None of the mentioned.
questions.correctAnswer: To prevent situations of run time error during change or conversion of data type.
questions.text: What is the need for Conversion of data type in C sharp.

questions.answers: 1<break time='1s'/> u short to long. 2<break time='1s'/> int to u int. 3<break time='1s'/> u short to long. 4<break time='1s'/> byte to decimal
questions.correctAnswer: int to u int. int is 32 bit signed integer whereas u int is 32 bit unsigned integer .Range of int is larger than u int. So, compiler cannot implicitly convert from larger datatype to smaller datatype.
questions.text: in which Type of Conversion the compiler is unable to convert the datatype implicitly.

questions.answers: 1<break time='1s'/> Makes program memory heavier. 2<break time='1s'/> Results in loss of data. 3<break time='1s'/> Potentially Unsafe. 4<break time='1s'/> None of the mentioned
questions.text: what are the Disadvantages of Explicit Conversion.
